intro: Microchilus whitefoordiae, commonly known as the Whitefoord's microchilus, is a rare and small flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous tiny florets. The plant produces delicate, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires a cool, humid environment to flourish. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
